intro: Syringodea gilva, commonly known as the silverleaf syringodea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, reflective hairs. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Syringodea gilva is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
